supply_logistics.supply_status: Critical. Division reformed after destruction at Second El Alamein with replacement personnel and limited equipment from Italy. Supply route via Sicily to Tunisia ports (Tunis, Bizerte, Sfax). Severe shortages of all categories - fuel, ammunition, vehicles, heavy weapons. Competition with German units for limited supplies arriving by sea and air. Allied naval and air interdiction reducing supply flow significantly.

weather_environment.season_quarter: 1942-Q4 (October-December) - Autumn to early winter in Tunisia
weather_environment.terrain_type: Tunisia - varied terrain including coastal plains, hills, cultivated areas, olive groves, wadis. More vegetation and water sources than Western Desert. Road network better developed but limited capacity.

tactical_doctrine.role: Reformed infantry division in Tunisia Campaign reorganization phase. Rebuilding and refitting after destruction at Second El Alamein. Positioned for defensive operations in central/southern Tunisia against Allied forces advancing from Operation Torch landings in Algeria.
special_capabilities: Veteran cadre of El Alamein survivors providing combat experience
Adaptation to varied Tunisian terrain versus pure desert warfare
Integration with German and other Italian units in Tunisia
known_issues: Severely understrength after El Alamein destruction - only 78% of Q3 strength
Critical equipment shortages - artillery reduced from 40 to 28 guns, AT guns from 8 to 6
Large proportion of inexperienced replacement personnel mixed with survivors
Supply situation critical - sea/air routes from Italy under constant Allied interdiction
Obsolete anti-tank weapons completely inadequate against Allied M3 Lee/Grant and M4 Sherman tanks
Low morale due to El Alamein defeat and supply shortages
Limited motorization restricts operational mobility in larger Tunisian theater
Vehicle losses at El Alamein - only 145 trucks versus 250 in Q3 (42% reduction)
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Transitioning from Western Desert to Tunisia - adapting to more varied terrain, better water availability, different climate with rainfall and cooler temperatures. Lessons from El Alamein applied to defensive operations.

scenario_suitability: Combined Axis operations with German forces in Tunisia
special_rules: Understrength: -2 penalty for reduced personnel and equipment
Supply critical: -3 penalty for severe supply shortages
Low morale: -2 due to El Alamein defeat and current situation
Mixed experience: Veteran NCOs/officers but many green troops
Obsolete AT weapons: -2 against medium/heavy armor

Retreat from El Alamein to Tunisia (November 1942)
Would continue fighting in Tunisia through May 1943 surrender
